review_title: Great place to work and learn
job_title: Computer Science Tutor in San Angelo, TX
pros: The Computer Science faculties are very nice and helpful. It is a flexible working environment. I started as a tutor for the summer code camp and became a CS tutor right after that. It is between 8-12 hours a week so you can take on some other job(for me it is IT) if you want to.
cons: Everything is great so there is not much to complain about. Tutors work in separate collaborate rooms so sometimes there would be so many students coming to my room and I tried to stay for 30 minutes to help them while there are tutors available in another room. This would be solved in an in-person session though.

job_title: Student Assistant in San Angelo, TX
pros: I enjoyed my time as a student assistant and the flexibility of working on-campus and doubt I could have found another job as understanding as this one was. I had great coworkers!
cons: Incredibly low pay. I had to ask for a pay raise after two years of working while others in the same position as me received small raises each semester. Even as a student, it was just too low and I couldn’t afford basic needs at certain periods of my time as a student but didn’t have time to take on a second job.

job_title: Desktop Field Services Technician in San Angelo, TX
pros:
- Working here as a student employee has given me the chance to gain professional IT experience while still being a full-time student. 

- The wages are above satisfactory for a college job, and there is always room to move up to higher roles and also transfer to other specialized departments. 

- This is a mentor-ship as well, so when it comes close to graduation, they actively try to help you work on your resume and help setup interviews and connections with different companies. 

- The hours are flexible and will always work around your class schedule as long as you can meet the 20 minimum hour limit.
cons:
- The workload can become a bit much, especially since we are students with classes and homework and are also limited to working 30 hours per week. 

- You are not allowed to work on homework while clocked in even during downtime which just about every other student job lets you do. 

- While the majority of the ASU faculty and staff are nothing but friendly and understanding, there is the occasional troublesome customer who is unreasonable and rude. As a customer service employee, it is your job to do whatever you can to help them with their issue, but it can be a bit degrading at times since some of the older staff here at ASU only see you as a young student worker who is inexperienced instead of a professional IT technician with the tools to fix their issue.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Humble, TX
pros: I had fun tutoring people!
cons: There weren't any cons, everything went smoothly.

job_title: Career Development Assistant in San Angelo, TX
pros: A nice place to work and the people are great!
cons: The staff pay is low

job_title: Student Assistant in San Angelo, TX
pros: Time management, professional environment, caring superiors, good coworkers, positive atmosphere
cons: Low pay, laborious, little growth opportunity

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Angelo, TX
pros: Angelo State's staff works as a team for the benefit of the students, which provides job satisfaction for staff members. They and the faculty work well together. Benefits are great including time off, retirement plans and insurance. Most of all, job satisfaction is high.
cons: The main downside is the usual office politics one sees in a large operation. It's not pervasive, but one should be cognizant of it.

job_title: Supplemental Instruction Leader in San Angelo, TX
pros: This is an amazing opportunity for students. Its really the best job you can have while in school because obviously they are going to work around your school schedule. Also if students do not come in for tutoring you get paid to study! My supervisor was awesome and so were my coworkers.
cons: One downside is that even though my coworkers were super friendly and enjoyable to be around they sometimes forgot that this was a work environment and would get a little rowdy but no big deal.

review_title: Some great people, a lot of not so great people.
job_title: Student Worker in San Angelo, TX
pros: I really enjoyed the people that I worked with. I also really liked working with the students who had a clue.
cons: I was not happy with the constant rearrangement of departments and policies. Quite a few of the "higher ups" were not good people and it was a struggle to work for them.

job_title: in San Angelo, TX
pros: Angelo State University provides wonderful opportunities for growth.  The paid holidays and attractive campus make it one of the best places to work in San Angelo, Texas.
cons: Depending on what department you work in at Angelo State University, you can experience a highly biased, politically motivated atmosphere that not only impedes growth but is detrimental to its very own alumni.

review_title: Best place I have ever worked for.
job_title: Applications Support Specialist in San Angelo, TX
pros:
- Flexible hours 
- Management that cares about their employees. 
- all of the full time employees take time out of their day to mentor and teach things like linux, best coding practices, Perl, and anything else that might be pertinent at the time. 
-leadership trusts you,  so absolutley no micromanaging.
- parking available right outside the applications department. 
- it's like a second family.
cons: No toxic leadership to complain about on Saturday's with your friends.

review_title: Great place to learn the fundamentals of Enterprise I.T.

1. Learn a lot if your willing.
2. Great team of part time and full time staff.
3. Work with your schedule very well between classes and real life.
4. Great way to learn the fundamentals of I.T. on a beginners level and grow on it.
5. Take interest in those who want to learn the field and are MIS/CS majors
cons: None really, just give your best and you will reap the benefits!

review_title: No reward for hard work or years of service
job_title: in San Angelo, TX

cons: There is little shared governance and too top heavy with highly paid administrators that do not really contribute to the mission of the organization. The workers who do the lion's share of the work are not appreciated or rewarded.

review_title: The job was up and down
job_title: Resident Assistant in San Angelo, TX
pros: Several of my coworkers are now close friends of mine and I stay in contact with many of my residents.
cons: There is a lot of picking favorites and drama that occurs in the housing department. The staff in charge claims that your education should be first, but will schedule mandatory events and office hours right up to class time, meaning you are late to class often.

review_title: I was a psychology graduate teaching assistant & it was an amazing experience, tons of feedback and training.
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistantship in San Angelo, TX
pros: The teachers were excellent and provided ample direction and feedback.  The classes were small (70 main lecture and 23ish discussion groups).  A lot of creative feedback is given for creating lectures and discussion groups.
cons: San Angelo is in the middle of nowhere, definitely not a big city atmosphere.

job_title: APA Coach in San Angelo, TX
pros: Very positive organizational culture, maintains the perfect balance between professionalism and friendliness. Very concerned about employee growth and satisfaction.
cons: I truly haven't encountered any while employed in either of the positions I've held within this organization. I can't speak for every position within every department, but the experiences I've had while working for ASU have been nothing but positive.
